page.title: 01The Village of DILHORNE
page.content: Dilhorne is a pleasant village of some sevenhundred inhabitants, lying approximately two miles north of Blythe Bridge and two miles west of Cheadle, in the Leek and Moorlands area of the county of Staffordshire. The central point of the village is its eleventh century church of All Saints, one of only seven churches in England with a octagonal tower. The church is one of four religious buildings within the village, the others being Methodist Chapels. The four churches are matched by four Public Houses within the area. The main Methodist Chapel is at Godley Brook and was errected through private donations and the formation of a charity in 1816.All the churches have supported the work of the village school.
